     About the Senate 
     The Senate plays a unique role in shaping our country’s democracy. As members of the upper house of Parliament, senators examine legislation, study public policy, champion causes and conduct interparliamentary diplomacy.  As a workplace, the Senate is composed of dynamic people representing our nation’s diverse talents, backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is provided full and equal opportunity and access to employment, development and advancement. Build and advance your career by joining a team of dedicated professionals who are committed to excellence in support of senators and the institution. 
    
    
     How will you contribute? 
     You will be responsible for the development of solution architectures aligned with industry best practices; for participating in all activities relating to the planning, design, development, stabilization and quality assurance phases of the projects; for participating to various committees within the Senate of Canada and with its external partners; for providing guidance and expertise to junior programmers and programmers; and to report on the progress of projects with the Technical Team Lead. 
    
    
     Open to 
     To staff one (1) indeterminate position in the Information Services Directorate. This selection process may be used to staff determinate or indeterminate positions at the same level with similar requirements. We encourage individuals from underrepresented and minority groups to apply. 
    
    
     Prerequisites 
     
      Graduation with a college diploma or university degree in Information Technology and/or Information Management;
       
      
       Experience in providing programming, analysis and infrastructure expertise in the development, integration and maintenance of business applications;
       Experience in leading small IT (Information Technology) project teams in the delivery of business applications;
       Experience in providing technical advice and recommendations on the implementation of application components;
       Experience in preparing detailed IT project plans;
       Experience in mentoring programmers and ensuring that their work is carried out in accordance with established industry standards and best practices;
       A minimum of three (3) years of experience developing business applications using the Microsoft .NET in C# and Microsoft SQL Server;
       A minimum of five (5) years of work experience in the information technology field, following completion of a college diploma or university degree in information technology or information management;
       Knowledge of project management principles and practices;
       Knowledge of agile development principles and practices;
       Basic Knowledge of cybersecurity development best practices;
       Knowledge of emerging information technologies and current IT industry standards and best practices.
       Knowledge of one or more of the following Technologies: .NET Core, Azure Devops, Razor/Blazor, C#, SharePoint would be an asset;
       Knowledge of web accessibility (WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.0) would be an asset;
       Experience with web Content Management systems (CMS) like Umbraco or Drupal or other
       Knowledge of Windows Server and IIS would be an asset;
